page.title: 12Wickhamford Church - two
page.content: The ordinary pews are where cottagers would sit and another kind called "box pews" where families from grand houses would sit. Above the chancel arch is a Royal Coat of Arms. There are traces of an earlier one underneath. In the chancel is a very grand tomb made of alabaster. It shows the figures of Sir Samuel Sandys and his wife and children. In the tomb next to the Sandys tomb is the eldest son Sir Edwyn Sandys, with his wife and children. Another tomb in the chancel is that of Penelope Washington, a relative of George Washington, first President of the U.S.A. It shows the Washington Coat of Arms, the prototype of the stars and stripes of the American flag.
